file.name: Image catalog files
file.description: Battle sprites animation catalogue. Contains 72 frames for walking (WK) or combat (CB) or 16 frames for dying sequence (DY). Entire .IMC file is compressed using DL variant od RLE. (see reader_drle.py) Next passages are describing contents of decompressed file.

array.description: Looks like pairs of words. Small numbers. Y/X frame offsets maybe.
Unknown data. Present only in non-DY files.

notes.note: Looks like motion-related. All zeroes for static monsters (M73, M90).

word.name: sprite_height
word.description: Height of sprite (height of all frames is same)

array.name: sprite_widths
array.description: Sprite widths for 8 directions (frames in one direction are having the same width)

word.name: frame_count
word.description: Frame count for one direction. File contains 8 * frame_count images.

word.name: data_length
word.description: Size of the rest of the file beyond the frame offsets.

notes.note: Starting beyond the end of this array
Divided by 16 for reason unknown. (so 'end+offset*16' is the start of frame data)
Each row of image starts with byte containing count of defined pixels.
Next byte containing count of starting empty pixels.
Then follows count_of_defined_pixels long sequence of pixels (pallete index bytes) to be rendered. (zero is transparent)
